etymology.description: semantic: 月(月) (yuè, 'moon/month') + phonetic: 古(古) (gǔ) = sound element -> associated with foreigners to the north of China
etymology.interpretation: The character 胡(胡) originally denoted people from beyond the northern borders of ancient China, often referring to non-Chinese tribes. The phonetic 古(古) (gǔ) provides the sound while 月(月) (yuè, 'moon/month') may relate to nighttime activities or timing, aspects associated with distant lands and peoples.

examples.chinese: 他穿着胡服(他穿著胡服)，看起来充满异域风情(看起來充滿異域風情)。
examples.pinyin: tā chuānzhe hú fú, kàn qǐlái chōngmǎn yìyù fēngqíng.
examples.english: He is wearing foreign-style clothes, and he appears full of exotic charm.

examples.chinese: 古代诗人喜欢描写胡地(古代詩人喜歡描寫胡地)，以表示对异国情调的向往(以表示對異國情調的嚮往)。
examples.pinyin: gǔdài shīrén xǐhuān miáoxiě hú dì, yǐ biǎoshì duì yìguó qíngdiào de xiàngwǎng.
examples.english: Ancient poets liked to depict the lands of foreigners, expressing their longing for exotic allure.

examples.chinese: 他研究胡文化(他研究胡文化)。
